entry.title: install
entry.content:
//
// this gradle build script fragment can be referenced from your build as
//
// apply from:“http://yuzen.koshinuke.org/install”
//
// Or you can copy the below directly into your build.gradle.
//
buildscript {
repositories {
mavenLocal()
mavenRepo url:‘https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/releases’
mavenCentral()
}
dependencies {
classpath ‘org.koshinuke:yuzen:0.0.4’
}
}
apply plugin: org.koshinuke.yuzen.YuzenPlugin

entry.title: Yuzen
entry.content:
Yuzen

Yuzen is a static contents generator similar to jekyll.

  • Yuzen is a Gradle Plugin
  • Yuzen uses clean template by Thymeleaf
  • Yuzen translates Markdown to HTML5
    • Yuzen parses Markdown by Pegdown
  • Yuzen contains some useful templates
    • blog
    • slide
    • site (this one)
  • Yuzen publishes contents to GitHub Pages and FTPS server

Requirements

  • java7 or more tested by 1.7.0_02
  • gradle 1.1
  • eclipse 3.7.2 (for development)
    • Groovy-Eclipse 2.6.1

Installation

  • Install Java SE 7 JDK
  • if you don’t have gradle,
    • Download latest release archive from here
    • Extract the archive.
      jar xvf yuzen-startup.zip
  • if you already use gradle,
    • apply plugin from this site.
      apply from: 'http://yuzen.koshinuke.org/install'
  • Modify gradle.properties
    • if you use github features, edit these keys
      • github.username
      • github.password
    • if your network is in firewall, edit these keys
      • systemProp.http.proxyHost
      • systemProp.http.proxyPort
      • systemProp.https.proxyHost
      • systemProp.https.proxyPort

How to Get Start a Blog

  • Initialize template
    gradlew initBlog
  • Edit build.gradle for blogging.
    blog { title 'blog title' subtitle 'sub title or blog description' profile 'profile 'minimum profile for sidemenu' // this block uses for atom or rss feed. feed { syndicationURI = 'http://localhost:8080/blog' author = 'john doe' } }
  • Write your profile to _contents/profile.md
    • contents files encoding require UTF-8
  • add first entry
    gradlew post -Ptitle=HelloWorld
  • Write your first entry to generated file.
  • Generate static contents
    gradlew startBlog
  • Access to localhost:8080
  • Check your generated contents
  • Edit build.gradle for publish to GitHub Pages.
    yuzen.publish { ghpages repoURI : "https://github.com/[your github account]/[your repository name].git" }
  • Publish to GitHub Pages. yuzen create or update gh-pages branch
    gradlew publish

How to build your Yuzen

  • clone repository
    git clone https://github.com/taichi/yuzen.git
  • make your eclipse environment
    gradlew eclipse
  • import project to eclipse
  • install to your maven local repository
    gradlew clean install
